level.heading: CONDITIONS FOR USE OF TWO-STEP SEALED BIDDING (ยง 27-1551)

level.text: The two-step sealed bidding method may be used when all of the following conditions are present:

Available specifications or purchase descriptions are not definite or complete, or may be too restrictive without technical evaluation, and discussion of the technical aspects of the requirement is needed to ensure mutual understanding between each prospective bidder and the District;
Definite criteria exist for evaluating technical proposals;
More than one (1) technically qualified source is expected to be available;
Sufficient time will be available for use of the two-step method; and
A firm-fixed-price contract or a fixed-price contract with economic price adjustment will be used.
None of the following issues shall preclude the use of two-step sealed bidding:
District-owned facilities to be made available to the successful bidder; or
